capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm really proud to say that I've had the privilege of working with Hagrid at Hogwarts. He's an incredible individual and a fantastic gamekeeper. I can confirm that he's indeed affiliated with the school, and I have no doubt about his commitment to the students and staff there.

I'm really proud to be affiliated with Hogwarts, it's an incredible school that has given me so much. I've had the privilege of working closely with some amazing people, like Professor Dumbledore and the rest of the staff, and I feel like I've learned so much from them. The sense of community here is just wonderful, everyone looks out for each other and we all work together to create a supportive environment for our students.

I'm really proud to be affiliated with Hogwarts, it's an incredible school that has given me so much. I've had the privilege of working closely with some amazing people, like Professor Dumbledore and the rest of the staff, and I feel like I've learned so much from them. The sense of community here is just wonderful, everyone looks out for each other and we all work together to create a supportive environment for our students.

I'm a huge fan of Hagrid, he's just so kind and caring towards the students here at Hogwarts. I mean, who else would take on the responsibility of looking after all those magical creatures in the care of the school? He's really made a difference in my life, and I think that's one of the things I love most about him - his unwavering dedication to what he believes in.

I'm a huge fan of Hagrid, he's just so kind and caring towards the students here at Hogwarts. I mean, who else would take on the responsibility of looking after the Care of Magical Creatures class? He's really made a difference in my life as well, being an ally to those who are often misunderstood or overlooked.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. what is the name of the character in the hogwarts lineup?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Flitwick is indeed my title and a kind of mantra for me as a professor. I'm quite certain about it, and I feel confident in saying that it's a big part of who I am.

I'm Valeria, and I have to say, Flitwick is indeed a very fitting title for someone who's so passionate about teaching and inspiring young wizards. His mantra of "Draco dormiens nunquam titillandus" - or "Never tickle a sleeping dragon" - really speaks to his approach of respecting the individuality and unique strengths of each student, even if they may seem like an unlikely candidate at first glance.
capsules_submitted.reply: i have heard this before. valeria mentioned that professor flitwick's title is a mantra.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm Valeria, and I have to say, Flitwick is an incredible individual. As the former Charms master at Hogwarts, he's truly lived up to his mantra of being a "mantra-professor" - always weaving magic into every lesson. His dedication to teaching and mentoring has left a lasting impact on many students, including myself.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. what does flitwick's physical appearance look like?

capsules_submitted.utterance: I've met Hagrid a few times, and I have to say, he's definitely one of the tallest people in the school. I mean, he towers over most of our professors, let alone students! It's quite impressive, really.
capsules_submitted.reply: i just learned something, i've never heard of someone called surprisingly tall before, can you tell me more about them?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Hagrid does look pretty tall for a half-giant, doesn't he? I mean, I've seen him towering over the rest of us in the Great Hall. It's one thing to hear about someone being tall, but it's another thing entirely when you see them standing right in front of you!
capsules_submitted.reply: i have heard this before. valeria told me that hagrid is quite tall.
